overview_of_class: Americans continue to debate why the Civil War happened and what its consequences were. In this class we will cover the Civil War Era, examining the war's causes, its revolutionary nature, and its ultimate consequences. Along the way we will investigate why mid-nineteenth-century Americans could not resolve their political disagreements without resorting to war; the extent to which slavery was at the heart of the conflict; why white southerners attempted to form their own separate nation and why they failed; how slavery ended; the prospect (and defeat) of interracial democracy; and what kind of nation ultimately emerged from the cataclysm.
name: The Civil War and Reconstruction
subject: HISTORY
